Description: THE DRINKING WATER TRIBAL SET-ASIDE (DWTSA) FUNDS ARE BEING AWARDED TO THE NAVAJO NATION TO FUND THE OPERATOR CERTIFICATION PROGRAM.  THIS PROGRAM ENSURES WATER OPERATORS ARE CERTIFIED TO THE LEVEL REQUIRED OF THE PUBLIC WATER SYSTEM THEY OPERATE AND MAINTAIN. THE PROPOSED PROJECT IS TO REPLACE WATERLINE INFRASTRUCTURE WITHIN THE ENTERPRISE MOBILE HOME PARK (MHP) ON THE CHEMEHUEVI INDIAN RESERVATION. WATER METERS WITH AUTOMATED METER READING CAPABILITY WILL ALSO BE INSTALLED AT EACH SERVICE LINE. THE NEW PIPE WILL PROVIDE SUSTAINABLE WATER SUPPLY TO THE COMMUNITY.  THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT PROVIDES FULL FEDERAL FUNDING IN THE AMOUNT OF $435,700.

THIS PROJECT IS FOR THE CONSTRUCTION OF THE FINAL CONNECTION FROM THE NAVAJO TRIBAL UTILITY AUTHORITY (NTUA) METER BOX AT THE BOUNDARY OF THE DZIL LIBEI ELEMENTARY SCHOOL TO THE WATER SYSTEM SERVING THE ELEMENTARY SCHOOL.  THIS DIRECT CONNECTION WILL ELIMINATE THE NEED FOR THE TUBA CITY UNIFIED SCHOOL DISTRICT TO MAINTAIN A SEPARATE WELL, STORAGE TANK, AND BOOSTER PUMPING SYSTEM FOR DRINKING WATER PURPOSES AT THE ELEMENTARY SCHOOL.  THE FUNDING WILL ALSO BE USED TO MAKE MODIFICATIONS TO THE EXISTING WATER SYSTEM AT THE ELEMENTARY SCHOOL SO THERE ARE NO CROSS CONNECTIONS BETWEEN THE POTABLE WATER AND FIRE SUPPRESSION SYSTEMS.  THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT PROVIDES FULL FEDERAL FUNDING IN THE AMOUNT OF $168,425.

THE PROJECT IS LOCATED WITHIN THE SALT RIVER PIMA MARICOPA INDIAN COMMUNITY (COMMUNITY) IN THE DOBSON HEIGHTS SUBDIVISION. THE DOBSON HEIGHTS SUBDIVISION WAS CONSTRUCTED IN THE LATE 1990S AND INCLUDES 28 HOMES AND A NEIGHBORHOOD CENTER. THERE IS AN EXISTING 4'' ASBESTOS CEMENT (AC) WATERLINE THAT RUNS ALONG THE NORTH SIDE OF PINCHOT DR.  THE SUBDIVISION IS LOCATED AT THE INTERSECTION OF DOBSON AND PINCHOT ROAD. THE RESIDENTS WITHIN THIS SUBDIVISION HAVE EXPERIENCED NUMEROUS WATERLINE BREAKS DUE TO THE EXISTING CONDITION OF THE WATER MAIN. THE NEW 8'' PVC (OR DIP) WATERLINE (WITH SERVICES) WILL BE CONSTRUCTED ON PINCHOT RD.   THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT PROVIDES FULL FEDERAL FUNDING IN THE AMOUNT OF $536,760.

DESCRIPTION:SECTION 1452 OF THE SAFE DRINKING WATER ACT (SDWA) AUTHORIZES THE STATE TO UTILIZE FUNDS TO FURTHER THE HEALTH PROTECTION OBJECTIVES OF SDWA. THIS AGREEMENT WILL PROVIDE FUNDS TO CAPITALIZE THE RECIPIENT'S DRINKING WATER STATE REVOLVING FUND (DWSRF) TO PROVIDE LOW INTEREST FINANCING FOR COSTS ASSOCIATED WITH THE PLANNING, DESIGN AND CONSTRUCTION OF ELIGIBLE DRINKING WATER IMPROVEMENT PROJECTS AND ACTIVITIES TO PROTECT HUMAN HEALTH. AS PART OF THIS AGREEMENT, THE RECIPIENT ENSURES COMPLIANCE WITH FEDERAL AND STATE REGULATIONS, WHICH ARE DESIGNED TO PROTECT PUBLIC HEALTH.  THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT PROVIDES FEDERAL FUNDING IN THE AMOUNT OF $8,123,000.  PREAWARD COSTS ARE APPROVED BACK TO 7/1/2022.  ACTIVITIES:THE BULK OF THE SRF WILL BE USED FOR LOANS AND OTHER AUTHORIZED ASSISTANCE TO PUBLIC WATER SYSTEMS FOR ELIGIBLE PROJECTS, INCLUDING IMPROVING DRINKING WATER TREATMENT, FIXING LEAKY OR OLD PIPES (WATER DISTRIBUTION), IMPROVING SOURCE OF WATER SUPPLY, REPLACING OR CONSTRUCTING FINISHED WATER STORAGE TANKS, AND OTHER INFRASTRUCTURE PROJECTS NEEDED TO PROTECT PUBLIC HEALTH. THE RECIPIENT MAY ALSO USE SOME OF THE FUNDING FOR SPECIFIC 'SET-ASIDES' TO PROVIDE TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE TO SMALL SYSTEMS, PROGRAM ADMINISTRATION, STATE PROGRAM MANAGEMENT AND OTHER ALLOWABLE USES. SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:THE BENEFITS OF THIS GRANT WILL BE TO CAPITALIZE THE RECIPIENT'S DWSRF. THE FUND CAN THEN BE USED TO INCREASE TECHNICAL, FINANCIAL AND MANAGERIAL CAPACITY OF PUBLIC WATER SYSTEMS, AND PROVIDE ASSURANCE OF A CLEANER AND SAFER POTABLE WATER SUPPLY BY FUNDING IMPROVEMENTS TO MULTIPLE WATER INFRASTRUCTURE PROJECTS.  THESE PUBLIC HEALTH BENEFITS WILL BE STATEWIDE.

DESCRIPTION:SECTION 1452 OF THE SAFE DRINKING WATER ACT (SDWA) AUTHORIZES THE STATE TO UTILIZE FUNDS TO FURTHER THE HEALTH PROTECTION OBJECTIVES OF SDWA. THIS AGREEMENT WILL PROVIDE FUNDS TO CAPITALIZE THE RECIPIENT'S DRINKING WATER STATE REVOLVING FUND (DWSRF) TO PROVIDE LOW INTEREST FINANCING FOR COSTS ASSOCIATED WITH THE PLANNING, DESIGN AND CONSTRUCTION OF ELIGIBLE DRINKING WATER IMPROVEMENT PROJECTS AND ACTIVITIES TO PROTECT HUMAN HEALTH. AS PART OF THIS AGREEMENT, THE RECIPIENT ENSURES COMPLIANCE WITH FEDERAL AND STATE REGULATIONS, WHICH ARE DESIGNED TO PROTECT PUBLIC HEALTH.ACTIVITIES:THE BULK OF THE SRF WILL BE USED FOR LOANS AND OTHER AUTHORIZED ASSISTANCE TO PUBLIC WATER SYSTEMS FOR ELIGIBLE PROJECTS, INCLUDING IMPROVING DRINKING WATER TREATMENT, FIXING LEAKY OR OLD PIPES (WATER DISTRIBUTION), IMPROVING SOURCE OF WATER SUPPLY, REPLACING OR CONSTRUCTING FINISHED WATER STORAGE TANKS, AND OTHER INFRASTRUCTURE PROJECTS NEEDED TO PROTECT PUBLIC HEALTH. THE RECIPIENT MAY ALSO USE SOME OF THE FUNDING FOR SPECIFIC 'SET-ASIDES' TO PROVIDE TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE TO SMALL SYSTEMS, PROGRAM ADMINISTRATION, STATE PROGRAM MANAGEMENT AND OTHER ALLOWABLE USES. SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:THE BENEFITS OF THIS GRANT WILL BE TO CAPITALIZE THE RECIPIENT'S DWSRF. THE FUND CAN THEN BE USED TO INCREASE TECHNICAL, FINANCIAL AND MANAGERIAL CAPACITY OF PUBLIC WATER SYSTEMS, AND PROVIDE ASSURANCE OF A CLEANER AND SAFER POTABLE WATER SUPPLY BY FUNDING IMPROVEMENTS TO MULTIPLE WATER INFRASTRUCTURE PROJECTS.  THESE PUBLIC HEALTH BENEFITS WILL BE STATEWIDE.

THESE GRANTS ALSO SUPPORT STATE PROGRAMS TO HELP SYSTEMS BUILD AND MAINTAIN TECHNICAL, MANAGERIAL AND FINANCIAL CAPACITY.

DESCRIPTION:SECTION 1452 OF THE SAFE DRINKING WATER ACT (SDWA) AUTHORIZES THE STATE TO UTILIZE FUNDS TO FURTHER THE HEALTH PROTECTION OBJECTIVES OF SDWA. THIS AGREEMENT WILL PROVIDE FUNDS TO CAPITALIZE THE RECIPIENT'S DRINKING WATER STATE REVOLVING FUND (DWSRF) TO PROVIDE LOW INTEREST FINANCING FOR COSTS ASSOCIATED WITH THE PLANNING, DESIGN AND CONSTRUCTION OF ELIGIBLE DRINKING WATER IMPROVEMENT PROJECTS AND ACTIVITIES TO PROTECT HUMAN HEALTH. AS PART OF THIS AGREEMENT, THE RECIPIENT ENSURES COMPLIANCE WITH FEDERAL AND STATE REGULATIONS, WHICH ARE DESIGNED TO PROTECT PUBLIC HEALTH.ACTIVITIES:THE BULK OF THE SRF WILL BE USED FOR LOANS AND OTHER AUTHORIZED ASSISTANCE TO PUBLIC WATER SYSTEMS FOR ELIGIBLE PROJECTS, INCLUDING IMPROVING DRINKING WATER TREATMENT, FIXING LEAKY OR OLD PIPES (WATER DISTRIBUTION), IMPROVING SOURCE OF WATER SUPPLY, REPLACING OR CONSTRUCTING FINISHED WATER STORAGE TANKS, AND OTHER INFRASTRUCTURE PROJECTS NEEDED TO PROTECT PUBLIC HEALTH. THE RECIPIENT MAY ALSO USE SOME OF THE FUNDING FOR SPECIFIC 'SET-ASIDES' TO PROVIDE TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE TO SMALL SYSTEMS, PROGRAM ADMINISTRATION, STATE PROGRAM MANAGEMENT AND OTHER ALLOWABLE USES. SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:THE BENEFITS OF THIS GRANT WILL BE TO CAPITALIZE THE RECIPIENT'S DWSRF. THE FUND CAN THEN BE USED TO INCREASE TECHNICAL, FINANCIAL AND MANAGERIAL CAPACITY OF PUBLIC WATER SYSTEMS, AND PROVIDE ASSURANCE OF A CLEANER AND SAFER POTABLE WATER SUPPLY BY FUNDING IMPROVEMENTS TO MULTIPLE WATER INFRASTRUCTURE PROJECTS.  THESE PUBLIC HEALTH BENEFITS WILL BE STATEWIDE.

DESCRIPTION:SECTION 1452 OF THE SAFE DRINKING WATER ACT (SDWA) AUTHORIZES THE STATE TO UTILIZE FUNDS TO FURTHER THE HEALTH PROTECTION OBJECTIVES OF SDWA. THE RECIPIENT MAY ALSO USE SOME OF THE FUNDING FOR SPECIFIC 'SET-ASIDES' TO PROVIDE TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE TO SMALL SYSTEMS, PROGRAM ADMINISTRATION, STATE PROGRAM MANAGEMENT AND OTHER ALLOWABLE USES. THESE PUBLIC HEALTH BENEFITS WILL BE STATEWIDE.

DESCRIPTION:THIS ACTION APPROVES AN AWARD IN THE AMOUNT OF $16,513.000 TO GEORGIA ENVIRONMENTAL FINANCE AUTHORITY TO SUPPORT THEIR DRINKING WATER STATE REVOLVING FUND WHICH AUTHORIZES THE STATE TO UTILIZE FUNDS TO FURTHER THE HEALTH PROTECTION OBJECTIVES OF SDWA. THIS AGREEMENT WILL PROVIDE FUNDS TO CAPITALIZE THE RECIPIENT'S DRINKING WATER STATE REVOLVING FUND (DWSRF) TO PROVIDE LOW INTEREST FINANCING FOR COSTS ASSOCIATED WITH THE PLANNING, DESIGN AND CONSTRUCTION OF ELIGIBLE DRINKING WATER IMPROVEMENT PROJECTS AND ACTIVITIES TO PROTECT HUMAN HEALTH. AS PART OF THIS AGREEMENT, THE RECIPIENT ENSURES COMPLIANCE WITH FEDERAL AND STATE REGULATIONS, WHICH ARE DESIGNED TO PROTECT PUBLIC HEALTH.ACTIVITIES:THE BULK OF THE DWSRF WILL BE USED FOR LOANS AND OTHER AUTHORIZED ASSISTANCE TO PUBLIC WATER SYSTEMS FOR ELIGIBLE PROJECTS, INCLUDING IMPROVING DRINKING WATER TREATMENT, FIXING LEAKY OR OLD PIPES (WATER DISTRIBUTION), IMPROVING SOURCE OF WATER SUPPLY, REPLACING OR CONSTRUCTING FINISHED WATER STORAGE TANKS, AND OTHER INFRASTRUCTURE PROJECTS NEEDED TO PROTECT PUBLIC HEALTH. THE RECIPIENT MAY ALSO USE SOME OF THE FUNDING FOR SPECIFIC 'SET-ASIDES' TO PROVIDE TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE TO SMALL SYSTEMS, PROGRAM ADMINISTRATION, STATE PROGRAM MANAGEMENT AND OTHER ALLOWABLE USES. SUBRECIPIENT:SUBAWARDS WILL BE MADE FOR ACTIVITIES SUCH AS ADMINISTERING LOANS FOR PROJECTS, PROVIDING TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE TO SMALL SYSTEMS, PROGRAM ADMINISTRATION, AND STATE PROGRAM MANAGEMENT. 

OUTCOMES:THE BENEFITS OF THIS GRANT WILL BE TO CAPITALIZE THE RECIPIENT'S DWSRF. THE FUNDS CAN THEN BE USED TO INCREASE TECHNICAL, FINANCIAL AND MANAGERIAL CAPACITY OF PUBLIC WATER SYSTEMS, AND PROVIDE ASSURANCE OF A CLEANER AND SAFER POTABLE WATER SUPPLY BY FUNDING IMPROVEMENTS TO MULTIPLE WATER INFRASTRUCTURE PROJECTS.  PUBLIC HEALTH BENEFITS WILL BE STATEWIDE.

OUTCOMES:THE VIDWCIG PROGRAM WILL HELP ENSURE THAT DRINKING WATER SUPPLIES IN VIRGIN ISLANDS REMAIN SAFE AND AFFORDABLE AND THAT PUBLIC WATER SYSTEMS, WHICH RECEIVE FUNDING, WILL BE PROPERLY OPERATED AND MAINTAINED. THE GOALS OF THE VIDWCIG PROGRAM INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING: (1)TO IMPLEMENT AND MAINTAIN THE VIDWCIG PROGRAM FOR THE TERRITORY OF THE VIRGIN ISLANDS. (2) TO PROVIDE FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE BY ADMINISTERING GRANTS TO ELIGIBLE PUBLIC WATER SYSTEMS FOR ELIGIBLE PROJECTS ASSOCIATED WITH THE CAPITAL IMPROVEMENTS OF WATER COLLECTION, STORAGE,

THIS GRANT AGREEMENT PROVIDES SUPPORT TO THE SENECA NATION OF INDIANS (SNI) TO MAKE INFRASTRUCTURE IMPROVEMENTS AT THE CATTARAUGUS WATER SYSTEM.  THE

THE RAQUETTE AND SAINT REGIS RIVERS ARE NATURAL BARRIERS THAT MAKE PROVIDING REDUNDANCY DIFFICULT IN ORDER TO PROVIDE REDUNDANCY, LOOPING OF WATER MAINS VIA RIVER CROSSINGS IS NECESSARY. THE SAINT REGIS MOHAWK TRIBE HAS DETERMINED THAT LOOPING MAINS VIA RIVER CROSSINGS IS A PRIORITY FOR THE GROWTH AND IMPROVEMENT OF THE EXISTING PUBLIC WATER SUPPLY. THE PROPOSED PROJECT IS TO CONSTRUCT NEW WATER MAINS ACROSS THE RAQUETTE AND ST. REGIS RIVERS. THE RIVER CROSSING PIPE WILL BE EITHER FUSED HOPE OR BALL AND SOCKET DUCTILE IRON.

THIS PROJECT WILL ASSIST THE SAINT REGIS MOHAWK TRIBE WITH EXPANDING THE CAPACITY AND RELIABILITY OF THE WATER SYSTEM.  THE CURRENT WATER MAIN IS NOT CAPABLE OF HANDLING THE FLOW WATER WITHOUT BEING OVER PRESSURIZED, THEREFORE THE WATER MAIN SIZE NEEDS TO BE INCREASED TO ALLOW THE MAXIMUM CAPACITY DURING PEAK DEMAND PERIODS WITHOUT CAUSING DAMAGE TO THE DISTRIBUTION SYSTEM (ON GARROW ROAD AND MCGEE ROAD).

THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT PROVIDES FUNDING TO THE SENECA NATION OF INDIANS TO REPLACE EQUIPMENT AT ITS RICHARDSON ROAD WATER SYSTEM THAT MALFUNCTIONS DURING EXTREME HEAT CONDITIONS AND HIGH SYSTEM DEMAND. SPECIFICALLY, THE PROJECT WILL REPLACE VARIABLE FREQUENCY DRIVES AND UPGRADE THE CLIMATE CONTROL SYSTEM WITH TEMPERATURE PROBES WITHIN THE SYSTEM CABINET TO PREVENT MALFUNCTIONS DUE TO OVERHEATING. THESE EQUIPMENT UPGRADES WILL HELP THE TRIBE TO FURTHER THE HEALTH PROTECTION OBJECTIVES OF THE SAFE DRINKING WATER ACT BY ENSURING UNINTERRUPTED DELIVERY OF CLEAN AND SAFE DRINKING WATER FOR ITS CITIZENS.

THIS GRANT AGREEMENT WILL FUND A PROJECT TO REPLACE EXISTING WATER MAINS THAT ARE DETERIORATING, AS EVIDENCED BY NUMEROUS BREAKS RECORDED BETWEEN 2013 AND 2020.  THE POOR CONDITION OF THE WATER MAINS IS A HEALTH AND SAFETY HAZARD DUE TO LOSS OF WATER SUPPLY, PRESSURE AND POTENTIAL CONTAMINATION OF THE DRINKING WATER SUPPLY.  THE ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED INCLUDE REPLACING 25,900 LINEAR FEET OF 6' AND 8' DUCTILE IRON WATER MAIN WITH PVC IN THE EXISTING RAQUETTE POINT AREA DISTRIBUTION SYSTEM, ALONG WITH 155 SERVICE CONNECTIONS, 25 FIRE HYDRANTS AND 42 GATE VALVES.  THE ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES INCLUDE A RELIABLE AND FUNCTIONING POTABLE WATER DISTRIBUTION SYSTEM CONSISTING OF UPDATED WATER MAINS, VALVES, FIRE HYDRANTS AND APPURTENANCES.  OUTCOMES INCLUDE THE CONTINUED PROVISION OF A SAFE AND RELIABLE POTABLE WATER SUPPLY TO THE TRIBAL MEMBERS OF THE SAINT REGIS MOHAWK TRIBE.

DESCRIPTION:THIS INFRASTRUCTURE INVESTMENT AND JOBS ACT (COMMONLY REFERRED TO AS THE BIPARTISAN INFRASTRUCTURE LAW) FUNDED GRANT WILL PROVIDE $824,061 IN FEDERAL FUNDS TO THE DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA'S DEPARTMENT OF ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENT.  THE FUNDS WILL PROVIDE THE DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA WITH ON-SITE CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND OVERSIGHT SERVICES TO FULLY SUPPORT THE DISTRICT'S ENDEAVOR TO ACCOMPLISH CONSTRUCTION AND/OR IMPROVEMENT OF DRINKING WATER FACILITIES AS AUTHORIZED UNDER THE SAFE DRINKING WATER ACT (SDWA). FEDERAL FUNDS IN THE AMOUNT OF $3,638,122 ARE CONTINGENT UPON AVAILABILITY.ACTIVITIES:ACTIVITIES PERFORMED BY THE DISTRICT DEPARTMENT OF ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENT (DOEE) AND THE U.S. ARMY CORPS OF ENGINEERS (USACE) INCLUDE SOLICITING AND EVALUATING PROPOSED WATER QUALITY PROJECTS IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE APPROVED PROJECT PRIORITY RATING SYSTEM; PREPARING THE PROJECT PRIORITY LIST (PPL) AND NOTIFYING THE PUBLIC; SELECTING PROJECTS FOR FUNDING; DISTRIBUTING FUNDS TO PROJECT PARTNERS; MAINTAINING THE PROJECT MANAGEMENT DATABASE; SUPERVISING DOEE AND PARTNER DESIGN AND CONSTRUCTION PROCESSES; REPORTING TO EPA ON GRANT ACTIVITIES, PROJECT STATUS AND OUTPUTS; CONTRACTING AND OVERSEEING USACE DRINKING WATER PROJECT MANAGEMENT SERVICES; MANAGING THE SAFE DRINKING WATER ADMINISTRATIVE GRANTS; AND FACILITATING THE DISTRICT'S PARTICIPATION IN THE DRINKING WATER NEEDS SURVEY (DWNS).SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:ANTICIPATED OUTCOMES INCLUDE DEVELOPMENT OF AN ANNUAL PPL AND INTENDED USE PLAN (IUP), ASSISTING IN THE DEVELOPMENT OF THE DWNS, REVIEWING AND COMMENTING ON PROJECT GRANT APPLICATIONS, ASSISTING WITH CONSTRUCTION PROJECT MANAGEMENT, AND PREPARING ANNUAL PROGRESS REPORTS. THE END OUTCOME WILL BE WATER SAFE TO DRINK FOR THE RESIDENTS OF THE DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA, WHERE EXISTING WATER TREATMENT PLANTS AND SYSTEMS ARE BEING UPGRADED AND EXPANDED TO ENSURE COMPLIANCE WITH CURRENT AND ANTICIPATED SAFE DRINKING WATER ACT REQUIREMENTS.  THE END OUTCOMES OF EACH FUNDED PROJECT CAN BE FOUND IN THE WORK PLANS OF THE INDIVIDUAL DRINKING WATER CONSTRUCTION GRANTS THE DISTRICT AND THE US ARMY CORPS OF ENGINEERS WILL BE OVERSEEING.  THE BENEFICIARIES ARE THE RESIDENTS OF THE DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA.

DESCRIPTION:SECTION 1452 OF THE SAFE DRINKING WATER ACT (SDWA) AUTHORIZES THE STATE TO UTILIZE FUNDS TO FURTHER THE HEALTH PROTECTION OBJECTIVES OF SDWA. THIS AGREEMENT WILL PROVIDE FUNDS, AUTHORIZED BY THE INFRASTRUCTURE INVESTMENT AND JOBS ACT (IIJA) (PL 117-58) (COMMONLY REFERRED TO AS THE BIPARTISAN INFRASTRUCTURE LAW (BIL)), TO CAPITALIZE VIRGINIA DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH'S (VDH) DRINKING WATER STATE REVOLVING FUND (DWSRF) TO PROVIDE LOW INTEREST FINANCING FOR COSTS ASSOCIATED WITH THE PLANNING, DESIGN AND CONSTRUCTION OF ELIGIBLE DRINKING WATER IMPROVEMENT PROJECTS AND ACTIVITIES TO PROTECT HUMAN HEALTH. AS PART OF THIS AGREEMENT, THE RECIPIENT ENSURES COMPLIANCE WITH FEDERAL AND STATE REGULATIONS, WHICH ARE DESIGNED TO PROTECT PUBLIC HEALTH.ACTIVITIES:THE BULK OF THE DWSRF WILL BE USED FOR LOANS AND OTHER AUTHORIZED ASSISTANCE TO PUBLIC WATER SYSTEMS FOR ELIGIBLE PROJECTS, INCLUDING IMPROVING DRINKING WATER TREATMENT, FIXING LEAKY OR OLD PIPES (WATER DISTRIBUTION), IMPROVING SOURCE OF WATER SUPPLY, REPLACING OR CONSTRUCTING FINISHED WATER STORAGE TANKS, AND OTHER INFRASTRUCTURE PROJECTS NEEDED TO PROTECT PUBLIC HEALTH. THE RECIPIENT MAY ALSO USE SOME OF THE FUNDING FOR SPECIFIC 'SET-ASIDES'; TO PROVIDE TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE TO SMALL SYSTEMS, PROGRAM ADMINISTRATION, STATE PROGRAM MANAGEMENT AND OTHER ALLOWABLE USES.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:THE BENEFITS OF THIS GRANT WILL BE TO CAPITALIZE THE RECIPIENT'S DWSRF. THE FUND CAN THEN BE USED TO INCREASE TECHNICAL, FINANCIAL AND MANAGERIAL CAPACITY OF PUBLIC WATER SYSTEMS, AND PROVIDE ASSURANCE OF A CLEANER AND SAFER POTABLE WATER SUPPLY BY FUNDING IMPROVEMENTS TO MULTIPLE WATER INFRASTRUCTURE PROJECTS. THESE PUBLIC HEALTH BENEFITS ACCRUE TO THE RESIDENTS OF THE COMMONWEALTH OF VIRGINIA.

DESCRIPTION:SECTION 1452 OF THE SAFE DRINKING WATER ACT (SDWA) AUTHORIZES THE STATE TO UTILIZE FUNDS TO FURTHER THE HEALTH PROTECTION OBJECTIVES OF SDWA. THIS AGREEMENT WILL PROVIDE FUNDS TO CAPITALIZE THE RECIPIENT'S DWSRF WITH AN EMPHASIS ON LEAD SERVICE LINE REPLACEMENT AND ASSOCIATED ACTIVITIES DIRECTLY CONNECTED TO THE IDENTIFICATION, PLANNING, DESIGN, AND REPLACEMENT OF LEAD SERVICE LINES. THE RECIPIENT MAY ALSO USE SOME OF THE FUNDING FOR SPECIFIC 'SET-ASIDES' TO PROVIDE TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE TO SMALL SYSTEMS, PROGRAM ADMINISTRATION, STATE PROGRAM MANAGEMENT AND OTHER ALLOWABLE USES.

THESE PUBLIC HEALTH BENEFIT THE STATE OF VIRGINIA.

THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES FUNDING UNDER THE WATER INFRASTRUCTURE IMPROVEMENTS FOR THE NATION ACT.  THIS ACT AUTHORIZES SUPPLEMENTAL DRINKING WATER STATE REVOLVING FUND (DWSRF) CAPITALIZATION GRANTS UNDER SECTION 1452 OF THE SAFE DRINKING WATER ACT, AS AMENDED IN A STATE IN WHICH THE PRESIDENT HAS DECLARED AN EMERGENCY UNDER THE ROBERT T. STAFFORD DISASTER RELIEF AND EMERGENCY ASSISTANCE ACT (42 U.S.C. 5121 ET SEQ.) RELATING TO THE PUBLIC HEALTH THREATS ASSOCIATED WITH THE PRESENCE OF LEAD OR OTHER CONTAMINANTS IN DRINKING WATER PROVIDED BY A PUBLIC WATER SYSTEM. THE ONLY ELIGIBLE COMMUNITY IS FLINT, MI. THIS FUNDING WILL PROVIDE FOR LEAD SERVICE LINE REPLACEMENTS, DISTRIBUTION SYSTEM UPGRADES, WATER TREATMENT PLANT UPGRADES, CORROSION CONTROL STUDIES AND ASSET MANAGEMENT.

THIS ACTION APPROVES FUNDING IN THE AMOUNT OF $604,000 TO MICCOSUKEE CORPORATION FOR THE UPGRADE THE TRIBE'S EXISTING DRINKING WATER TREATMENT PROCESS TO ADDRESS WATER QUALITY PARAMETERS THAT ARE NOT WITHIN DESIRED LEVELS SUCH AS TOTAL HARDNESS, HYDROGEN SULFIDE, IRON, AND TOTAL ORGANIC CARBON.

THIS ACTION APPROVES AN AWARD IN THE AMOUNT OF $649,000 TO EASTERN BAND OF CHEROKEE INDIANS FOR THE PURPOSE REPLACING THE U.S.441 WATER MAIN LINE TO PROVIDE SAFE DRINKING WATER FOR 125 HOMES ON THE RESERVATION IN SWAIN COUNTY, NORTH CAROLINA.
THIS ACTION APPROVES AN AWARD IN THE AMOUNT OF $663,000 TO THE SEMINOLE TRIBE OF FLORIDA TO PROVIDE SAFE DRINKING WATER FOR 74 HOMES ON THE SEMINOLE

THIS GRANT IS FOR A PROJECT THAT WILL ADD AN ION EXCHANGE UNIT TO PRE-TREAT RAW WATER FROM THE PRIMARY DRINKING WATER WELL, IN ORDER TO REMOVE DISSOLVED ORGANIC COMPOUNDS (DOC). THE REDUCTION OF DOCS WILL REDUCE THE NUMBER OF FEDERAL DRINKING WATER VIOLATIONS BY REDUCING THE FORMATION OF TRIHALOMETHANE (THM) IN THE DISTRIBUTION SYSTEM.
